decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming your opponent with aggressive red creatures and burn spells. By utilizing efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage along with powerful burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage, you aim to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The deck also includes land cards that can deal damage or create tokens to further pressure your opponent. With a focus on speed and direct damage, this deck aims to close out games before your opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to control the tempo of the game by using a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw abilities. The deck aims to keep the opponent's board clear while maintaining card advantage and setting up for powerful late-game plays. Key cards like Divide by Zero and Consider help to filter through the deck for important answers, while cards like Boomerang Basics and Torch the Tower can deal with threats on the board. With careful resource management and strategic decision-making, the deck seeks to outlast opponents and secure victory through incremental advantages.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's strategy by using a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and creature removal. It also utilizes mana dorks like Llanowar Elves to accelerate its game plan. The deck aims to control the game by keeping the opponent on the back foot with its efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay while also using powerful threats like Sentinel of the Nameless City to pressure the opponent. Additionally, it has the ability to generate additional mana with cards like Mutavault and Darkbore Pathway to cast its spells ahead of schedule.

The main concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creatures while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Archon of Emeria. The deck aims to quickly build a board presence using cards like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves to ramp into powerful threats like Skyclave Apparition and Elspeth, Storm Slayer. The deck also includes powerful synergy with cards like Collected Company and Ouroboroid to maintain pressure and close out the game swiftly.

The main concept of this deck is to unleash a fast and aggressive strategy focused on utilizing Arclight Phoenix to quickly deal damage to the opponent. With a mix of cheap spells, card draw, and efficient creatures, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and maintain pressure throughout the game. The inclusion of various instant and sorcery spells allows for flexibility and adaptability in different scenarios, while also fueling the graveyard to bring back the powerful Arclight Phoenix multiple times for devastating impact.

This combo deck focuses on generating value through sacrificing creatures and forcing discards, while also utilizing a variety of powerful legendary creatures to control the board and create game-winning scenarios. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy through hand disruption and removal spells, while building up its own board presence through sacrificing creatures for beneficial effects. With a mix of control elements and combo potential, this deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with its diverse and synergistic strategies.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively use cheap spells and creatures to deal damage quickly to the opponent. The deck focuses on using prowess triggers and burn spells to control the board and pressure the opponent's life total. Academic Dispute and Boomerang Basics provide card advantage and disruption, while Emberheart Challenger and Monastery Swiftspear offer a strong attacking presence. The deck also utilizes a mix of instant and sorcery spells to trigger prowess abilities and maximize damage output. Overall, the strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient aggro game plan.

The main strategy of this UW Control deck is to establish card advantage and control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card draw. The deck aims to out-value opponents by using cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Meticulous Archive to generate card advantage, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Dovin's Veto. The deck also includes sweepers like Supreme Verdict to deal with threats on the board, as well as utility lands like Field of Ruin to disrupt opponent's mana base.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements such as hand disruption and removal spells to impede the opponent's game plan. It also utilizes efficient mana ramp in the form of Llanowar Elves and Badgermole Cub, allowing for early plays and threatening larger creatures. The inclusion of versatile cards like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Ouroboroid provide flexibility in handling a variety of threats. Additionally, the deck incorporates a mix of land destruction with cards like Tear Asunder and Culling Ritual to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on deploying efficient creatures like Archon of Emeria and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben early on to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also utilizes powerful cards like Elspeth, Storm Slayer and Skyclave Apparition to control the board and pressure the opponent. With cards like Collected Company and Elvish Mystic ramping up mana, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive game plan, while also having access to Boseiju, Who Endures for added resilience in key matchups.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. It also capitalizes on the synergies with Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to provide additional value and card advantage. The deck aims to out-value and outlast opponents, using cards like Memory Deluge and March of Otherworldly Light to dig for answers and maintain control of the battlefield. It also includes additional win conditions like The Wandering Emperor and Pinnacle Starcage to close out games efficiently.

The main idea of this deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy using a combination of counterspells, bounce spells, and removal. The deck aims to constantly generate card advantage through draw spells and efficient spells like Gran-Gran and Cori-Steel Cutter. Utilizing a mix of burn spells and creatures like Stormchaser's Talent, the deck can also apply pressure on the opponent while maintaining control of the game. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and enable consistent casting of spells.

The main concept of this deck is to build a fast and aggressive Selesnya Aggro strategy in Pioneer 1 vs 1 format. The deck focuses on playing low-cost creatures like Badgermole Cub and Skyclave Apparition early on while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Archon of Emeria and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. Collected Company helps to quickly get more creatures on the board, while cards like Elspeth, Storm Slayer provide additional threats and potential finishers. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of early aggression and disruptive elements.

The main objective of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and spells. By playing efficient threats like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, along with burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Cori-Steel Cutter and Emberheart Challenger provides additional ways to pressure the opponent. With a low mana curve and a focus on tempo, this UR Aggro deck seeks to maintain control of the battlefield and finish the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board and deal damage to your opponent quickly. By utilizing cheap spells and creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, you can apply pressure early on while also disrupting your opponent's game plan with cards like Boomerang Basics and Reckless Rage. The aim is to overwhelm your opponent with a combination of creature damage and spells, finishing them off with powerful finishers like Stormchaser's Talent and Torch the Tower. The deck's mana base is focused on ensuring you have the right colors available at all times for your spells.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on playing efficient creatures early on to pressure the opponent and disrupt their game plan. The key strategy is to curve out with mana-generating creatures like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, then follow up with powerful threats like Archon of Emeria and Skyclave Apparition. By utilizing cards like Collected Company and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, the deck aims to control the board and maintain a dominant position throughout the game. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Ouroboroid and Aven Interrupter provide additional utility and protection for the aggro strategy.
